question: Find the second highest salary from the Employee table without using LIMIT or TOP keywords.
Write a query to find employees who earn more than their manager.
Write a SQL query to get the nth highest salary from an Employee table.
Find departments where the average salary of employees is greater than the overall company average salary.
Given a table of orders, find customers who placed orders in consecutive months.
Write a query to find employees who never received a bonus.
Find all pairs of employees who share the same manager and have the same hire date.
Write a SQL query to find top 3 products by revenue in each category.
Given a transactions table, find users who made at least one transaction every month in 2024.
Find customers who ordered products worth more than the average order value of all customers.
Write a query to rank employees within each department based on their salary.
Find the running total of sales for each day.
Find duplicate records in a table without using DISTINCT or GROUP BY.
Given a log of page visits, find the most frequent sequence of 3 consecutive pages visited by a user.
Find all employees who have never worked on a project with their direct manager.
Write a SQL query to pivot sales data by region and month.
Given student scores, find the median score per subject.
Find users who have placed an order in every quarter of the year.
Write a SQL query to detect consecutive attendance streaks of employees.
Given product reviews, find the top 2 most reviewed products in each category.
Find employees who have the same salary as the average salary of their department.
Write a query to find the cumulative number of signups over time.
Given stock prices, find the days with local maxima and minima.
Find the longest sequence of days when a user logged in consecutively.
Write a SQL query to get the percentage contribution of each department to the company payroll.
Find users who made purchases using more than one payment method.
Write a SQL query to find products that were never sold in the last 6 months.
Given a friendship table, find all indirect friends (friends of friends) for each user.
Find the top 3 employees who contributed the most to revenue growth in each quarter.
Write a query to identify churned customers (who have not made a purchase in the last 3 months).
Find the ratio of active to inactive users per month.
Write a SQL query to detect data anomalies in transaction timestamps (e.g., overlapping times).
Given a payment log, find users who made increasing payments for 3 consecutive transactions.
Find employees who joined before their managers.
Write a SQL query to identify duplicate email addresses across different user accounts.
Given a product catalog and sales table, find products with declining sales trends over the last 3 months.
Find cities where every branch has achieved sales greater than $1M.
Write a query to calculate moving average of sales for the past 7 days for each product.
Find users who placed exactly two orders on the same day.
Find all users who have ordered both product A and product B but not product C.
Write a SQL query to find overlapping booking periods for the same hotel room.
Find the user who has the longest time gap between two consecutive logins.
Find employees who have worked on every project in their department.
Write a SQL query to normalize a denormalized table containing repeated attributes.
Find users whose total spending is in the top 1% across all users.
Find all users who have rated every movie in a particular genre.
Write a SQL query to compute retention rate for users week over week.
Given sales data, find the product that had the maximum percentage growth compared to the previous month.
Find the earliest date when cumulative sales crossed $10M.
Write a SQL query to calculate user engagement score using multiple activity metrics (logins, posts, comments).
Write a SQL query to find the top 3 most profitable customers for each region.
Find users who placed an order every month for the past 12 months consecutively.
Write a query to calculate the year-over-year revenue growth for each product.
Given a table of users and their followers, find the top influencer (user with the highest number of followers).
Find employees who have the same salary, job title, and department as another employee.
Write a SQL query to detect missing dates in a time series of daily sales data.
Given a stock trades table, find the day each stock reached its all-time high closing price.
Find all users who have made at least one transaction in every category.
Write a SQL query to find the average time between two consecutive orders per user.
Find all movies that have never received a rating below the average rating of all movies.
Write a query to find the top 5 customers contributing to 50% of total sales.
Given employee salary history, find the latest salary record for each employee.
Find all pairs of employees whose combined salaries exceed the company average salary.
Write a SQL query to find customers who downgraded their subscription plan.
Find the date when the cumulative number of users first exceeded 1 million.
Given student grades, find those whose grades improved consecutively for 3 exams.
Write a SQL query to calculate the weighted average rating per product.
Find all users who have placed exactly one order in the last 6 months but more than five in total.
Given an orders table, find all days when total revenue dropped compared to the previous day.
Write a SQL query to find overlapping appointments for each user.
Find the user who has the shortest average time between two purchases.
Write a query to find employees who changed departments more than twice.
Find the top 3 cities that contributed the most to company revenue in each year.
Given product reviews, find users who reviewed every product in at least one category.
Write a SQL query to identify the first purchase date for every customer.
Find the longest continuous streak of daily logins per user.
Write a query to calculate total revenue per quarter and compare it with the previous quarter.
Find the most common purchase combination of two products bought together.
Write a SQL query to detect outlier transactions (those that are more than 3 standard deviations from the mean).
Find the product with the highest percentage of returned orders.
Write a query to get the first and last order details for each customer.
Find all pairs of users who follow each other mutually.
Write a SQL query to calculate the customer lifetime value (CLV).
Find all departments where every employee earns above the average salary of all employees.
Write a SQL query to calculate a rolling 3-month revenue average per region.
Find customers who have never placed an order after their first purchase month.
Write a query to identify employees who have reported to at least two different managers.
Find all users who have rated more than one product with the same rating score.
Write a SQL query to find the maximum gap between two order dates per customer.
Find the product whose sales have grown consecutively for the last 4 months.
Write a SQL query to get the ratio of active to inactive users per week.
Find users whose first purchase was of the most expensive product.
Write a SQL query to find categories that contributed less than 5% of total sales.
Find employees who joined before the average joining date of their department.
Write a query to identify users who have used the platform in every year since signup.
Find top 3 most common search queries per user.
Write a SQL query to identify products whose price fluctuated more than 20% over the last quarter.
Find users who have made purchases both online and in-store within the same month.
Write a query to calculate month-over-month growth in user registrations.
Find users who have placed at least one order from each of the last 6 months.
